View on GitHub

artsdata-data-model

Overview of how data is modelled in Artsdata.ca.

Event - http://schema.org/Event

Thing > Event

An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

  • Open Issues
  • Leave Feedback

Properties

Property Expected Type Description From Class
location   The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place. http://schema.org/Event
offers   An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use businessFunction to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a Demand. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer. http://schema.org/Event
startDate   The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format). http://schema.org/Event
endDate   The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format). http://schema.org/Event
superEvent   An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent. http://schema.org/Event
performer   A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor. http://schema.org/Event
duration   The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format. http://schema.org/Event
eventStatus   An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled. http://schema.org/Event
organizer   An organizer of an Event. http://schema.org/Event
name   The name of the item. http://schema.org/Thing
url   URL of the item. http://schema.org/Thing
description   A description of the item. http://schema.org/Thing
image   An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject. http://schema.org/Thing
sameAs   URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item’s identity. E.g. the URL of the item’s Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website. http://schema.org/Thing
alternateName   An alias for the item. http://schema.org/Thing

More Specific Types
